content.description:
Not a bad route at all, fun traverse, good feet.  A little run out.   

  Here is the Beta   1. Clip first Bolt on Free Hander   2. Clip first Bolt on Everything Zen    3. Clip Second bolt on A.D.I.D.A.S (I think)    4. Clip 3rd bolt on A.D.I.D.A.S (take off second bolt to prevent drag or run it out to here.    5. Clip 4th bolt on A.D.I.D.A.S (Stay Right on crimps)   6. Clip bolt across on 'let your pimpness shine'    7. Clip last bolt on lather boy, finish off on crux of lather boy.   

  I thought the route was fun, it did not feel like a lot of drag either, fall may hurt...  The crux is between #6,#7 of the description.
content.location: Starts on Free Hander (way left side of wall) ends on lather boy (third to last route from the right side of wall)

content.description: Fairly sustained 5.8/9 to a crux before the anchors. Staying left of the bolts is easier and going right is a little harder.
Good holds separated by thin powerful moves. The route culminates with a thin slab top-out after a rest in  a large hueco.
content.protection: 6 bolts, shares anchors with Randall's One Trick Pony
content.location: Now the furthest right route on the wall. Starts using the first bolt on Randall's One Trick Pony and trends left after the hueco to the joint anchor.

content.description: Really cool moves, awesome lie back on a protruding flake halfway up. Sweet route. At the top you can stay on face and make it 5.10 or move to the right for a slightly easier finish on the top slab.
content.location: Last route on the right end of the platform.

content.description: Excellent route, with fun flowing moves. There is a crux low just past the first bolt, and one high just after the last bolt. Clipping the anchors can be a tad pumpy as well.
content.location: This route is the fourth route in from the left on top of the platform

content.description: The start moves up through a unique horn/jug, to a crux at the first bolt. The moves afterward become easier, but due to the bulgy nature of the route it actually becomes pumpy. The routes crux comes at the top and includes surmounting a slopey bulge, and a low angle undercling in a large hueco. Cool route, well bolted.
content.location: Third route in from the right end of the platform.

content.description: Climb up to big pocket then to the right on crimps. Crux comes as you move your way out of the vertical terrain, and onto the slab.
content.location: Furthest left on adidas wall. Start is about 10 feet left from the edge of the platform.

content.description:
Sustained route, some long reaches. No real distinct crux. Move left after the last bolt onto great pinches, then finish out with a pumpy/stemming anchor clip. Use caution when clipping the anchors as the fall does not look very forgiving. 

    After putting up a TR on this route (in the cleaning process) the first ascentionists were approached by a hiker. He asked what they were up to, and they replied "climbing".  He looked at the ropes and harnesses, shrugged and said something to the effect of "thats nothing, a few years back I freehanded that". Thus it came to be known as Freehander.
content.location: First route on the left side of the platform.

content.description: After reaching the first bolt, the climbing is thin and sustained until the end. The thin holds make this a slow pumpy lead.
content.location: Second route in from the left on top of the platform.

content.description: The crux is at the 2nd bolt with good holds. The upper section is easy with good stone. It's a new section of the wall so please help brush.
content.location: Â the left end of Adidas wall

content.description: Starts off with a difficult move to the first bolt.  Fun climbing up to the last bolt with a powerful move to the anchors.  Neat climb.
content.location: If you park at the pullout nearest the overlook but not at the overlook and take the trail down it is about 100 yards past Particle Man.  There are two routes in that section, its the route on the left.

content.description: This is an clean wall with many beginner to intermediate routes, excellent flat rock platform at the bottom, and a good long V1 boulder problem that traverses its base. Faces west so it gets sun almost all afternoon.
